Chipotle Mexican Grill is facing another food safety crisis, month after...
By: Daniel Rodriguez |December 3rd, 2015|Read More..
Chipotle Mexican Grill says food safety measures are underway amidst crisis.
At least the queso cheese they introduced was pretty good?
You guys don't have a single clue, is clear!
It seems like no one knows who to blame.
No surprise that all this happened, especially after taking Steve Ells out of the chain‚Äôs leading role.
Chipotle is getting destroyed by this crisis, they're on the line of bankruptcy.
If it's not broke,don't fix it!
Chipotle may have food safety issues but one thing is for sure: it ain't no corporate clone fast food joint.
I'm sure that's just what the customers want...to hear about the companies legal issues in court from a sales associate!
I hope they bounce back from all these disasters!
The only reason is because the quality of the food and presentation has went down.
I worked at chipotle, they clearly know what happened they just choose not to disclose, typical corporate greed.
I'll bet my money on "undercover agents".
Chipotle Mexican Grill is making some changes to their food and operations in an effort to rebound from recent crises affecting their sales!
Let me tell you something that is also an issue... people like me who love Chipotle are not eating their Queso cheese by itself or buying the brand from the grocery store.
Chipotle should start doing customer reviews on steroids scandals of former employee's!
So you're an angry customer that wants more details from Chipotle while simultaneously accusing us of not having a clue.
No, it's really that bad... *shakes head* It seems you people at Chipotle need some kind of an exorcism or smth!
I think my brain stopped working after I read about their new 'digital experience platform'?
Do companies still talk about having the latest buzzwords like it's something innovative?

?
The biggest issue with that story is not the 15% reduction in staff at company level but the fact that customers were getting turned away during peak hours due to understaffing... you know what it says, not much good for customer satisfaction...
. Also, who comes up with this corporate speak?
???... How is THAT supposed to help Chipotle recover from the crisis it's been facing?
Is that even a real thing in business?
Can anyone explain what exactly that means?
More jargon from Silicon Valley.

?
A digital transformation project focused on creating personalized experiences for customers (e.g., targeted promotions), streamlined menu boards, and mobile ordering / self-service kiosks.
What does that even mean?! Is it some kind of AI powered burrito bot or something?
??? Is that supposed to be some kind of joke?

????
Hey @chipotle here's an idea:
How about you improve your current problems (see: E.Coli) before jumping into fancy tech buzzwords?
What even does that do for me, the customer who just wants to get a decent burrito bowl without having to use some ridiculous app?
Can someone please explain what that even means?
like what even is that.
More jargon for 'trying not to mess up too much'.
??? Yeah you need to figure out who makes decent software for your restaurant system, Chipotle.
What does that even mean

???.

???‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Can't wait to dig in and get more info on it!
???What in the world does that even mean?

what does that even means

Like wut?

Maybe they are too busy thinking about digital instead of actual food experience?
??? I have zero interest in Chipotle's social justice initiatives or how many tons of food waste they're reducing, but I guess it's...nice of them to prioritize that.
What does that even MEAN?
?. That's literally not even english.
More buzzwords from a brand that continues to lose its way.
??? what kinda nonsense is that
... who does that

????

Is that industry speak for 'we gave up trying'?
! That's just what I want in a taco, some techno mumbo jumbo.

Wth.
????. It seems like no one knows what exactly means!

.
Like seriously?

like what does it even mean

?

It's when you get all emotional while ordering food online.
Nope!
Just kidding!

(PS: The writer may have just eaten too much guac)
In their attempt to regain popularity, Chipotle went tech-happy ‚öôÔ∏è!

Digital Experience Platform"... sure, sounds important.

Um... yeah, sure.

Okay, maybe I'm being unfair.

But hey, at least their efforts are headed in a positive direction

"We're dedicated to building a culture of innovation that leverages technology"

We're going to make an app and hope for the best.

This corporate talk, right?

That sentence is corporate speak for ‚Äúwe have no idea what we‚Äôre doing but here‚Äôs a buzzword.‚Äù

But honestly though, if it means getting guac free, count me in!

Anyway, the future might look bright if they get their act together?
Can you summarize the article?

The company behind Chipotle, Chipotle Mexican Grill (CMG), has announced they're shifting focus towards more tech stuff like apps, mobile ordering, and digital marketing so people can interact with the brand differently (or something).
Yes!
Basically Chipotle Mexican Grill (just realized how extra long their name is) plans to improve customer experiences through tech enhancements, because the usual ways weren't working out.
Just say Chipotle wants to revamp their brand using tech and stuff... That's literally it!
There isn't much to summarize: Chipotle is trying to improve its online presence by investing heavily in tech and marketing changes.

The CEO of Chipotle wants the company to invest in tech,
he thinks online ordering is a must-have,
wants employees focused more on customer service,
plans a ‚Äòdigital experience platform‚Äô (whatever that means), and 
is trying to re-brand the company as tech-friendly
